newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar hoists its way back from lows.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar hoists its way back from lows.

text.p: White sugar futures picked up from earlier lows in routine Thursday activity with light trade buying supporting nearby values, market sources said.
Earlier in the session, commission house players crossed the Dec/Mar spread but interest dwindled later in the day and some outright trades were seen in both nearby positions, they said.

December saw some 300 lots against actuals trades by one leading commission house, while European buyers were noted in the second-month March contract. "There's nothing really very important going on," one trader said.
At 1615GMT December stood $1.10 firmer at $323.10 and March also up by that margin at $320.20. Volume was 1,620 lots, dominated by the two front contracts.
December managed to hold above the $321.00 low notched up during Wednesday's session but technical analysts said the price outlook was bearish as support at $320.00 was under pressure.
Trading was thin in Paris where volume totalled 203 lots.
December was 50 cents higher at $322.00 and March unchanged at $319.50.
